title: Optima with ?
content:
Hello all,

I’ll be getting started on a redesign for a healthcare book that used Optima as the headline style and Garamond as the body. This new book is part of a series and the publishers want to stick with Optima as the headline style but is willing to consider another body face. Does anyone have any suggestions for me to explore? Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

Tammy

 [‹ RED, WHITE & BLACK True colors?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112904/http:/www.typophile.com/node/8702 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bitmap Fonts for Mobile Phones ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112904/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12509 "Go to next forum topic")
author: starlux

comments.content: I’m holding a [book](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112904/http:/print.google.com/print?id=UV3XROXhn5oC&lpg=7&&pg=7&sig=IWR-HEox7pUsdFPnOCNsRiyS7rY) right now that uses Optima for headings and Zapf’s own [Melior](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112904/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/melior/) for body text. I think it looks sharp. For some reason I find that Melior looks kind of “scientific” in a friendly way — it must be something with the squarish letterforms — so it would be appropriate for a book on healthcare.
Thanks! I took a look at the page you linked to...looks good...and fits the subject matter. I’ll definitely check it out further.

starlux if you are interested in Melior you should check out Remontoire from [MacRhino](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112904/http:/www.macrhino.com/).

Whole site is flash, but dig to the RETAIL fonts and you’ll find it.
Remontoire...very nice. I’ll have to see if I can get them to buy both so I can experiment. Thanks for the suggestion.

Tiffany,

Thanks for making a push for Remontoire, And Starlux, please let me see the result if you decide to use Remontoire later on. BTW my site is actually 100% “Flash-free”. ;-)

Cheers/SH
Am I seeing a bug in the site, or did Miss Tiffany link back to typophile.com?
